answers.answer: New arrivals in Timișoara can find information on how to manage in the city and who can provide assistance.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-timisoara and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The Immigration Bureau of the County Timiș can be contacted via email at tm.igi@mai.gov.ro or by phone at +40256-402434, +40256-402431, or +40256-402432.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-timisoara and read the section under 'Important contacts Immigration Bureau of the County Timiș'.

answers.answer: The Timișoara for Ukraine Support Center can be reached by calling +40356 993 or via WhatsApp at +40741 113 952.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-timisoara and read the section under 'Timișoara for Ukraine Support Center'.

answers.answer: The National Anti-Traffic Hotline Romania can be reached by calling +40800 800 678 or +4021 313 3100.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-timisoara and read the section under 'National Anti-Traffic Hotline Romania'.

answers.answer: This is a support program designed for accommodation, meals, and integration in Timișoara, for which more information is required.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-timisoara and read the section under 'The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Timișoara'.

answers.answer: For medical services, you can contact the Emergency Municipal Clinical Hospital, or the Louis Țurcanu Children's Emergency Clinical Hospital for children.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-timisoara and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: A list of family doctors in Timișoara is available on the website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-timisoara and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: Plan International Organization offers psychological assistance for adults and children of refugees from Ukraine in various cities in Romania. Elena Dinon is the contact for more information.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-timisoara and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: In Timișoara, you can use the STPT public transport system for free, but you may need to show an ID if requested.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-timisoara and read the section under 'Transportation'.

answers.answer: Educational units in Timiș with Ukrainian language teaching include Kindergarten and Secondary School no. 2 Timisoara, Secondary School no. 24 Timisoara, and "William Shakespeare" Theoretical High School, among others.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-timisoara and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: Enrollment applications for Ukrainian preschoolers and students in Timiș County educational units can be found on the website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-timisoara and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: The LOGS Association provides social and legal counseling, financial support, medical assistance, Romanian language courses, and facilitates access to jobs for immigrants.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-timisoara and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The Timiș County Youth Foundation (FITT) offers psychological support, help in finding a job, and Romanian and English language courses through its Ukrainians in Timiș program.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-timisoara and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: Save the Children Timiș offers English language classes for children, a part-time kindergarten program for children over 4, and other activities.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-timisoara and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The Women's Center offers support for accessing reproductive health services, navigating the health system, and services for victims of domestic violence.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-timisoara and read the section under 'Women's Center'.

answers.answer: People living with HIV can receive free, anonymous, and confidential psycho-medical-social services from specialist doctors at 10 Regional HIV Centers in Romania and support from Sens Pozitiv.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-timisoara and read the section under 'Counseling for people living with HIV'.

answers.answer: Information regarding housing in Timișoara is available under the 'Housing Info' section.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-timisoara and read the section under 'Housing Info'.

answers.answer: Information on finding jobs in Timișoara is available under the 'Jobs' section.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-timisoara and read the section under 'Jobs'.
